greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary expansion of Sum_{n>=1} A006218(n)*2^(-n).
comment: With offset 1 this is the binary expansion of the Erdős-Borwein constant (A065442). Erdős (1948) proved that this constant is irrational by showing that its binary expansion has arbitrarily long strings of zeros. - _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 01 2020
link: David H. Bailey and Richard E. Crandall, Random generators and normal numbers, Experimental Mathematics, Vol. 11, No. 4 (2002), pp. 527-546. See p. 540.
Paul Erdős, On Arithmetical Properties of Lambert Series, J. Indian Math. Soc., Vol. 12 (1948), 63-66.
xref: Cf. A006218, A065442, A211701, A211705 (decimal representation)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 19 2012
